instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Chime No Display
threads.message:
Water damaged board, typical suspects were bad.

<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> termination points weren't continuous, fixed that. Replaced any corroded/damaged components.
Wasn't getting <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> and no PP5vS4Rs3 so had to replace <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> 

Now fans spin up, green light & orange, but no full boot. No USB light up, CPU VCORE is at 1.72v and it doesn't get warm at all.

All power rails check out. <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> area is a little warm, but there was no liquid damage around there so I don't think it's necessarily the culprit? I'd like to not have to remove it unless it comes down to it. Any suggestions?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Chime No Display
threads.message: Came back today and it works just fine now. Not sure what was up. You can mark this as solved.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Chime No Display
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Chime No Display
threads.message:
inspect <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> before you send this out. If the V-core is present but the CPU doesnt get hot <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> is the usual cause.
Check this before you send it out/sell it to prevent chance of returns

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Chime No Display
threads.message: Forgot to mention that I did replace <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> prior to v-core being present. I've tested it out thoroughly and all tests check out fine. Been running for 5 hours, boots & shuts down fine, all functions operational. CPU gets nice and toasty.
